statement.title: # Content
statement.content:
You are given circular array $a\_0, a\_1, \cdots , a\_{n - 1}$. There are two types of operations with it:
1. `inc(lf, rg, v)` — this operation increases each element on the segment $[lf, rg]$ (inclusively) by $v$;
2. `rmq(lf, rg)` — this operation returns minimal value on the segment $[lf, rg]$ (inclusively).

Assume segments to be circular, so if $n = 5$ and $lf = 3, rg = 1$, it means the index sequence: `3, 4, 0, 1`.

Write program to process given sequence of operations.

statement.title: # Standard Input
statement.content: The first line contains integer $n$ ($1\leq  n \leq  200000$). The next line contains initial state of the array: $a\_0, a\_1, \cdots , a\_{n - 1}$ ( $- 10^6 \leq  a\_i \leq 10^6$), $a\_i$ are integer. The third line contains integer $m$ ($0 \leq  m \leq  200000$), $m$ — the number of operartons. Next $m$ lines contain one operation each. If line contains two integer $lf, rg$ ($0 \leq  lf, rg \leq  n - 1$) it means `rmq` operation, it contains three integers $lf, rg, v$ ($0 \leq  lf, rg \leq  n - 1$, $ - 10^6 \leq  v\leq 10^6$) — `inc` operation.

statement.title: # Standard Output
statement.content: For each `rmq` operation write result for it.

statement.content:
